intro: Pentameris distichophylla, commonly known as the two-ranked fern, is a unique species belonging to the family Blechnaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive two-ranked arrangement of pinnae, which gives it a striking visual appearance. The plant is native to the temperate regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. Its fronds are typically evergreen, with a leathery texture and a dark green color. Pentameris distichophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky slopes.
